name: horizontal weyland
description:
Okay, so Netrunner is a game. Games should be fun right? Well, I'm submitting this deck to play and have a good laugh while doing it. I went 4 out of 5 tonight playing it, so it CAN win...it just requires you to understand how to build threats, and to balance risk. Basically this is a weyland jinteki deck. Essentially you're threatening meat damage all the time.

So you can play out 3 remotes unprotected, doing pad-pad-drt or snare-drt-pad or whatever. Just get DRT's in play. Then get a data raven on a remote (with one on a central) then also get a false lead scored. From there, false lead is your game winner.

I can explain more combos if you want, but theres so many threats that its a hoot to play. Try it out for 5 games and then bring back comments.

name: ParaKate v2.0
description: Kate-parasite recursion deck for effortless running. Put a stranglehold on R&D and keep the ice on their advancement server dead.

name: More Money v 1.0
description: Based on the idea, that the Corp needs more money than they can produce to protect themself. Importend is the Xanadu in the starting hand. With the high rest costs the Corp is more or less defenceless. If they rez a piece of ICE the virus will take care of the rest. Ice Carver is a nice addition for the parasides and the Icebreaker. Still need practice and fiddle around a bit...

name: Operation Chastise v1.0
description:
Just a first look at what a Punitive Counterstrike might look like. The deck uses mostly 3 pointers since they would provide the maximum damage with that, and there's little ICE since you're supposed to flatline the Runner, not waste your time advancing Agendas!

Anyway, there's also big pieces of ICE to help possibly scoring a 5/3 in early game. If you manage to score The Cleaners, after all, things should become way smoother.

Jackson Howard should help recycle both PC and Snare!, but maybe 3 copies are overkill. Just didn't know what to do exactly with that last influence point... a Wall of Thorns, maybe?

Also, one less Data Raven to add a single SEA Source could help against "overly" cautious Runners.

Power Grid Overlay is there to take care of those damn Plascrete Carapace that people like to have against Weyland. And plenty of economy cards to have the money to actually manage to blow'em up for good. Commercialization because you should really advance those Hadrians, Ice Walls and possibly Shadow. Less ICE means it'll have to be harder to pass, or you could as well go without, right?

Finally, the name is obviously a reference to corporal punishment, it's "meat" damage after all! But it's also a reference to WWII, and the British mission who took place in... Ruhr Valley, in May 1943.

name: Chaos_V1.2C -- ctr
description: R&D Control with fixed strength icebreakers and a touch of ice destruction.

name: Andromeda_V1E -- eco
description: Get your rig out and keep economy under control.

name: Chess is Hard v0.4
description:
Still work in Progress

So I was itching to make a 'Chess Deck'.

The aim of this deck is to make it costly for the Corp to rezz ICE. Any ICE rezzed will get lowered strength so cheap breakers may pass.

Make it Expensive: - Costly to rezz ICE

  • Reina
  • Rook
  • Xanadu
  • Emergency Shutdown (to some degree)

Make it Weak: - Easier to bypass ICE

  • Datasucker
  • Bishop
  • Ice Carver

Make it Break: - Get past the ICE

  • Knight
  • Crypsis
  • Yog.0 or ZU.13 Key Master
  • Mimic or Ninja
  • Corroder
  • Emergency Shutdown (to some degree)

Make it Bleed: - Deny them cards they want/need

  • Medium
  • Imp
  • HQ Interface
  • Sneakdoor Beta

Idea is to prevent Corp from rezzing ice while stacking up Mimic so you can access more and more cards, trashing the good ones with Imp. Any good ice they rezz you place Knight on to break or Bishop to weaken for your icebreakers to pass until Datasucker can do it for you.

Hurt their economy with Emergency Shutdown in strategic places.

Access HQ through Archives with Sneakdoor Beta, making their HQ ICE worthless while you hurt the R&D ICE with Caïssa.

name: Self-Replicating Wyrmy Parasite Recursion
description:
Replicate Personal Touch on Wyrm to make using it with Parasites very cheap, or if you're lacking those it works well with Atman (preferably put Wyrm on an Omni-Drive) Prepaid Voice Pads turn into extra cash for every use of Dirty Laundry and Sure Gamble, or cover Test Run. Test Run + Scavenge = free Femme for really tough ice. Inside Man pays for all the hardware, SC prevents corp from trashing your expensive, modded Wyrm.

Yes it's fat, but with all the tutors that shouldn't be a problem, and once the hardware is mostly installed you can Levy back your econ cards. Exile gets cards for every Scav, TR and Clone Chip.

Comments welcome

name: Gabriel/Shaper
description: Nothing fancy, just the core Criminal deck with Diesel and Gordian Sword swapped in.
